intro: Fimbristylis corynocarya, commonly known as the narrow-leaf flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in moist environments such as wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Fimbristylis corynocarya is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
